instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> th1H sensor error
threads.message:
Hello everybody;

Working on this machine come service with fan noise and %400 kernel task use problem. ASD OS not shows error, ASD EFI shows [COLOR=#FF0000][B]Th1H sensor is reading above the high limit [/B][/COLOR]

Checked and replaced, <TRANSISTOR>Q5501</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q5503</TRANSISTOR>,<CHIP>U5550</CHIP> nothing change.

Where can i check next step?

Note: not liquid sign machine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> th1H sensor error
threads.message: Did you let ASD continue on error? If TH1H is reading off and it is not <TRANSISTOR>Q5503</TRANSISTOR> then TH2H should give an error too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> th1H sensor error
threads.message:
When run ASD first time after parts replace ASD nothing show error but fan spins high [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] . Run second time ASD give same error but third time no error:( 

Note: Fan noise and kernel task starts 2-3 min later after machine power on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> th1H sensor error
threads.message: Is <CAPACITOR>C5552</CAPACITOR> on the board, I think it is no stuff but replace if present. Check traces to <TRANSISTOR>Q5501</TRANSISTOR>/03.
